channel.title: Mushroom mission
channel.description:
You will need: 50 g of Amanita Muscaria (Siberian, smoke dried) A few of friends Someone wiht a car on possible hospital duty A decent Set and Setting A method of eating them
These are the mushrooms: [img]http://images.redial.net/mushrooms.jpg[/img]
This is my chosen method of eating them... PIZZA. [img]http://images.redial.net/pizza.jpg[/img]
Its currently 14:24 its been 10 mins I have started the waiting game, i estimate about 80 mins.
Anyone had any musroom experiences?
I will keep all of you who are interested up to date with the results here.

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

So anyways, hope you had fun Hex Key

Just to help clear up any confusion, I read up on the effects from them. I think it was unfair how PaulT was comparing them to psilocybin mushroom trip, as I just read off wikipedia:

The effects of muscimol are substantially different from psilocybin, as the chemicals target separate parts of the brain. Muscimol has been shown to lack "structured" hallucinations in most cases, and the effects are frequently compared to a lucid dream state.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

i r teh cool for IVing bleach.

Ok. I don’t even have to make fun of you, you handle it by yourself.

amanitas can be just as "mind opening" based on set and setting. you should really understand basic principles and have an inkling of chemistry.

They can be, but your vague references to undefined basic principles (are you really so obssesed with the language of academia that you can use phrases like this without any context?) and chemistry (without actually mentioning the active ingredients in either shrooms or amanitas) doesn’t support your theory.

That was infact written as a commentary to Strassman, smart arse.
Set and setting describes the context for psychoactive and particularly psychedelic drug experiences: one's mindset and the setting in which the user has the experience. This is especially relevant for psychedelic or hallucinogenic experiences; the term was coined by Timothy Leary.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]Dude stop arguing

I found aminatas to be mentally relaxing and not much else, hence my short description of them. In a nutshell, they suck. I’ll let you figure out for yourself that an aminata experience is hardly a trip.

set/setting/drug

Congratulations, you’ve read a little Timothy Leary. Now go do some acid and really open your mind.[/quote]

That was infact written as a commentary to Strassman, smart arse.

p.s. +++cool for doing acid dude

i r teh cool for IVing bleach.

amanitas can be just as “mind opening” based on set and setting. you should really understand basic principles and have an inkling of chemistry.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Dude stop arguing

I found aminatas to be mentally relaxing and not much else, hence my short description of them. In a nutshell, they suck. I’ll let you figure out for yourself that an aminata experience is hardly a trip. Only experience will show you this, I realize now I can never convince you.

set/setting/drug

Congratulations, you’ve read a little Timothy Leary. Now go do some acid and really open your mind.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

PaulT:

A shrooms trip is eight/twelve hours of intense hallucination and introspection. It could never be described as predictable, and is certianly much less so than an Amanita experience.

I was quantifying predictablity, everything has a degree of predictability.

On shrooms it is possible to forget you are on drugs, who you are, and what you are doing, and become completely involved in recognizing the beautiful patterns of nature.

did i ever say it wasnt? amanitas can produce very similar intensities of experience, but so can meditation.

An amanita trip is extremely mentally relaxing

ROFL

you appear to be just spouting random drug facts at a tangent, that youve read to support an arguement that doesnt exist/that you keep changing. Dude stop arguing, thats not what this post was intended for. It is safe to say, using the affirmation of set/setting/drug, that if you’re hunting for a box in which to place psychedelic spirituality, you can’t just pin it on a drug without also bringing set and setting to bear.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

YOU TALK SUCH UTTER TRASH.

A shrooms trip is eight/twelve hours of intense hallucination and introspection. It could never be described as predictable, and is certainly much less so than an Amanita experience. On shrooms it is possible to forget you are on drugs, who you are, and what you are doing, and become completely involved in recognizing the beautiful patterns of nature.

An amanita trip is extremely mentally relaxing, more like opium than shrooms in many ways, and it does not produce hallucinations or introspection anywhere near the level of shrooms.

Which is better? That’s an opinion.

Which is a more intense and psychedelic experience? Magic mushrooms win over amanitas any day.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @The_Cursed The Cursed
item.description:
@The_Cursed wrote:

[quote=“Hex Key, post:16, topic:55884”][quote author=PaulT link=topic=79225.msg874833#msg874833 date=1170899940]

Dont even bother comparing to acid, like i said Amanitas are a different type of trip wiht a very different purpose. I dont rate it worse than what you call “real magic mushrooms” paul, you ought to look at the more subtle qualities imo they are completely different trips and not really comparable.

They are completely different, but that’s why I compare them. Aminatas produce a relatively weak experience compared to most other commonly used psychadellic ethnogens. For example Salvia, another legal substance, is much more potent and produces a much more intense spiritual trip. From what you’ve been saying, I have trouble believing you have actually done magic mushrooms. The intensity of a shrooms trip is so above and beyond and utterly so much more amazing and spiritual than the slight inebriation of an Amanita experience that it’s a joke to even call Amanitas shrooms.
[/quote]

i find it hard to believe you have done amanitas when you trash talk like this. For sure they dont come on as fast, but they are far less predictable. As for the spiritual nature of amanitas, dont get me started - they are one of the most important ingredients of soma. you might be interested in take an amanita R.E. lesson, before YOU TALK SUCH UTTER TRASH.

http://www.jamesarthur.net/mm_01.html[/quote]
Hooray for Hex Key and his weird mushrooms!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Hex Key:

You seriously have no clue of the true powers of amainta muscaria and pantherina, quit talking like you the guru at this shit. Jeez.

I was tripping on shrooms when you were sucking on your mothers tit. Amanita’s are ok and I’ve done them quite a few times, but they are a mild stumble and a waste of money compared to the intense trips that you get from doing real magic mushrooms.

http://www.erowid.org/plants/mushrooms/mushrooms.shtml
http://www.erowid.org/plants/amanitas/amanitas.shtml

and i have had both and consider them for completely different purposes.

Right, and if you want to trip, take magic mushrooms. Amanitas are an experience, but definitely nothing on the level of shrooms or acid or salvia or methylone or any other of the wacky wonderful ways there are to break down the barriers between mind and matter.

Read full topic

item.title: Mushroom mission
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Do mushrooms have to contain psilocybin to be considered "real" psychoactives?

Keyword: Magic.

I’ve done Amanita’s, and I’ve done psilocybin mushrooms, and I can tell you that it’s like comparing a preschoolers crayon sketch of his mommy to the mona lisa.

Read full topic
